articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, Daniel González, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: Transgender women in migrant caravan face new struggles seeking asylum in U.S.
articles.description: Transgender migrants from Central America who traveled in a caravan through Mexico are now being held in a remote detention center in New Mexico.

articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, Daniel González, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: Transgender woman seeking U.S. asylum in migrant caravan dies in ICE custody
articles.description: Advocates want U.S. immigration authorities to stop holding transgender migrants after Roxana Hernandez, a transgender woman, died while being detained at a facility in New Mexico.

articles.author: Arizona Republic, Nathan J. Fish, Arizona Republic
articles.title: Protesters demand Gov. Doug Ducey condemn Trump immigration policy
articles.description: Dozens of protesters rallied at the Arizona Capitol and demanded to speak with Gov. Doug Ducey about border policies.

articles.author: Arizona Republic, Daniel González, Arizona Republic
articles.title: Flier instructing migrant parents how to locate separated children draws criticism
articles.description: The U.S. government is distributing a flier to help parents find their kids after they have been separated at the border.

articles.author: Arizona Republic, Richard Ruelas, Arizona Republic
articles.title: Ducey takes credit for criticizing an Obama immigration policy that never existed
articles.description: Ducey said he has long fought immigration policies that separate families. As evidence, he cited his opposition to an Obama-era policy that never was.

articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, Rafael Carranza and Daniel González, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: AG Jeff Sessions vows to separate kids from parents, prosecute all illegal border-crossers
articles.description: In Arizona, U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions promises to prosecute every migrant who crosses the border illegally.

articles.author: The Arizona Republic, Daniel González, The Arizona Republic
articles.title: As migrant caravan reaches Tijuana, a difficult decision awaits
articles.description: About 300 migrants in Tijuana are mulling whether to seek asylum in the U.S. “Some may get cold feet,” one volunteer with the migrant caravan said.

articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, Nathan J. Fish, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: Phoenix vigils held Wednesday highlighted deaths of 2 migrant women
articles.description: Two Phoenix vigils highlighted the recent deaths of two migrants, one killed by a border patrol agent and the other died while in ICE custody.

articles.author: The Arizona Republic, Daniel González and Rebecca Plevin, The Arizona Republic
articles.title: Migrant caravan: Rallies, weddings before migrants enter the United States to seek asylum
articles.description: The Central American migrants who traveled through Mexico in a caravan are presenting themselves at the U.S. border in a bid for asylum.

articles.author: The Republic, Daniel González, The Republic
articles.title: Deported Arizona mom makes new life in Mexico but misses kids 'dearly'
articles.description: It has been a rough year for 36-year-old mother Guadalupe Garcia de Rayos, deported on Feb. 9, 2017, after having lived in Arizona for 21 years.

articles.author: Arizona Republic, Dianna M. Náñez, Arizona Republic
articles.title: Migrant children: Separated from his mother, 7-year-old boy becomes one of first to be reunited
articles.description: A Guatemalan mom, who sued Trump after being separated from her child under the "zero-tolerance policy," reunites with her 7-year-old son.

articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, Daniel González, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: Migrant caravan in Mexico smaller, but not disbanded, as travelers meet with lawyers
articles.description: The caravan of asylum seekers in Mexico that angered President Trump remains intact for now but will disband in Mexico City next week.

articles.author: Arizona Republic, Daniel González, Arizona Republic
articles.title: 'Do you want to go back to Guatemala?' Court gives glimpse into migrant family separations
articles.description: Boys and girls, some as young as 5, filled the wooden benches inside the Phoenix Immigration Court, offering a glimpse into the humanitarian crisis.

articles.author: Arizona Republic, Dianna M. Náñez, Arizona Republic
articles.title: Migrant children: Separated from his mother, 7-year-old boy is one of first to be reunited
articles.description: A Guatemalan mom, who sued Trump after being separated from her child under the "zero-tolerance policy," reunites with her 7-year-old son.
